Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Court: Superior Court of State of California, County of Santa Clara
Private Litigation Case Title: Mynaf, et al. v. Taco Bell Corp.
Info Source: https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1041061/000104106102000003/form10k2001.htm
Notes: The SEC document linked here does not mention the settlement amount, which is taken from "Taco Bell shells out $13 million in OT suit," Nation's Restaurant News, March 19, 2001 (via Nexis).

Description: In a Proposition 65 settlement with the state, KFC agreed to warn California customers that its fried or baked potatoes contain acrylamide, a chemical known to cause cancer. It also agreed to pay $341,000 to the state.
Info Source: https://www.oag.ca.gov/news/press-releases/kfc-corp-agrees-comply-proposition-65-warnings
https://web.archive.org/web/20101110015128/http://www.ag.ny.gov/media_center/2010/sep/sep21a_10.html

Company: KFC Corp. and Harman Management Corp.
Description: Kentucky Fried Chicken and Harman Management Corp. agreed to pay $294,000 in settlement of allegations by District Attorneys of Los Angeles, Napa, San Mateo and Santa Clara counties that their new grilled chicken ovens emitted smoke inside kitchens to a level that violated health and safety laws, with improper installation and lack of advice to franchisees in environmental health requirements.
Info Source: https://www.sccgov.org/sites/da/newsroom/newsreleases/Pages/NRA2012/KFCPAYS$294,000FORSMOKINGOVENSSAFETYVIOLATIONS.aspx
https://web.archive.org/web/20090813021420/http://eeoc.gov/litigation/settlements/settlement07-03.html
